1.text: Then came to Jesus scribes and Pharisees, which were of Jerusalem, saying,

2.text: Why do thy disciples transgress the tradition of the elders? for they wash not their hands when they eat bread.

3.text: But he answered and said unto them, Why do ye also transgress the commandment of God by your tradition

4.text: For God commanded, saying, Honour thy father and mother: and, He that curseth father or mother, let him die the death.

5.text: But ye say, Whosoever shall say to his father or his mother, It is a gift, by whatsoever thou mightest be profited by me;

6.text: And honour not his father or his mother, he shall be free. Thus have ye made the commandment of God of none effect by your tradition.

7.text: Ye hypocrites, well did Esaias prophesy of you, saying,

8.text: This people draweth nigh unto me with their mouth, and honoureth me with their lips; but their heart is far from me.

9.text: But in vain they do worship me, teaching for doctrines the commandments of men.

10.text: And he called the multitude, and said unto them, Hear, and understand:

11.text: Not that which goeth into the mouth defileth a man; but that which cometh out of the mouth, this defileth a man.

12.text: Then came his disciples, and said unto him, Knowest thou that the Pharisees were offended, after they heard this saying?

13.text: But he answered and said, Every plant, which my heavenly Father hath not planted, shall be rooted up.

14.text: Let them alone: they be blind leaders of the blind. And if the blind lead the blind, both shall fall into the ditch.

15.text: Then answered Peter and said unto him, Declare unto us this parable.

16.text: And Jesus said, Are ye also yet without understanding

17.text: Do not ye yet understand, that whatsoever entereth in at the mouth goeth into the belly, and is cast out into the draught?

18.text: But those things which proceed out of the mouth come forth from the heart; and they defile the man.

19.text: For out of the heart proceed evil thoughts, murders, adulteries, fornications, thefts, false witness, blasphemies:

20.text: These are the things which defile a man: but to eat with unwashen hands defileth not a man.

21.text: Then Jesus went thence, and departed into the coasts of Tyre and Sidon.

22.text: And, behold, a woman of Canaan came out of the same coasts, and cried unto him, saying, Have mercy on me, O Lord, thou Son of David; my daughter is grievously vexed with a devil.

23.text: But he answered her not a word. And his disciples came and besought him, saying, Send her away; for she crieth after us.

24.text: But he answered and said, I am not sent but unto the lost sheep of the house of Israel.

25.text: Then came she and worshipped him, saying, Lord, help me.

26.text: But he answered and said, It is not meet to take the children's bread, and to cast it to dogs.

27.text: And she said, Truth, Lord: yet the dogs eat of the crumbs which fall from their masters' table.

28.text: Then Jesus answered and said unto her, O woman, great is thy faith: be it unto thee even as thou wilt. And her daughter was made whole from that very hour.

29.text: And Jesus departed from thence, and came nigh unto the sea of Galilee; and went up into a mountain, and sat down there.

30.text: And great multitudes came unto him, having with them those that were lame, blind, dumb, maimed, and many others, and cast them down at Jesus' feet; and he healed them:

31.text: Insomuch that the multitude wondered, when they saw the dumb to speak, the maimed to be whole, the lame to walk, and the blind to see: and they glorified the God of Israel.

32.text: Then Jesus called his disciples unto him, and said, I have compassion on the multitude, because they continue with me now three days, and have nothing to eat: and I will not send them away fasting, lest they faint in the way.

33.text: And his disciples say unto him, Whence should we have so much bread in the wilderness, as to fill so great a multitude?

34.text: And Jesus saith unto them, How many loaves have ye And they said, Seven, and a few little fishes.

35.text: And he commanded the multitude to sit down on the ground.

36.text: And he took the seven loaves and the fishes, and gave thanks, and brake them, and gave to his disciples, and the disciples to the multitude.

37.text: And they did all eat, and were filled: and they took up of the broken meat that was left seven baskets full.

38.text: And they that did eat were four thousand men, beside women and children.

39.text: And he sent away the multitude, and took ship, and came into the coasts of Magdala.
